title: Measuring Statistical Data Distribution in Cultural Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental statistical concepts (mean, variance, standard deviation) and data visualization
context.additional_context: Learners primarily use smartphones, engaging through asynchronous video lectures and discussion board activities

learning_goals: Calculate data distribution metrics (mean, mode, variance) from multicultural datasets (e.g., traditional event cycles) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply statistical data distribution concepts to real-life problems (e.g., analyzing local festival schedules) and derive appropriate conclusions with at least 70% accuracy.

Learners engage in five or more data interpretation discussions with three or more peers on the LMS discussion board and write feedback meeting at least two of the three rubric criteria (clarity, logical coherence, evidence provision)

resources: Statistical calculation tools (simple calculator or spreadsheet template)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
